thread.title: Sheriff thinks more needs to be done in case of accused teacher
thread.title_full: Sheriff thinks more needs to be done in case of accused teacher

author: 13abc
title: Sheriff thinks more needs to be done in case of accused teacher
text:
13abc (WTVG) - A dispute between the Bryan School board and the local sheriff is brewing over the discipline of a teacher.
This all stems from an alleged incident at the home of an art teacher from Bryan Middle School and two teenage girls who were 14 and 15 at the time.
The students allegedly stumbled on some sex toys in a drawer. Then they were driving somewhere else and the teacher decided to turn around and take them back and show them the toys in greater detail.
The Williams County Sheriff, Steve Towns, is asking about this incident now because he was wondering whether there was a record of it, but he found at Ohio jobs and Family Sevices there was no record.
The school board claims it did report the incident, saying, "A report was made to Children's Services who chose not to pursue the matter at that time."
The board went on to say, "The Sheriff complained directly to the School Board and attempted to intimidate them to take action against a Bryan school employee."
According to the board the independent investigator and a Special Prosecutor found that there had been no crime and no cover-up by the District or the Board They added that while the employee may have exercised poor judgment, nothing criminal occurred.
Steve Towns, the Sheriff of Williams County said,"Any comments the schools have made against me or the school board have made against me have been misrepresented. I've tried to help everybody, but mostly we're here to be the kids' advocate. We're here for the children in their safety. And that is the bottom line."
The sheriff does consider this an open investigation and says it is not over.
